SENT.plain: Urinary N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminidase (NAG-ase) activity is a very sensitive parameter of kidney proximal tubular damage
Using urinary NAG-ase activity/urinary creatinine as the NAG index, the serum methotrexate (MTX) level and urinary pH were investigated simultaneously
These parameters were measured in 17 leukaemic children
During MTX treatment, NAG indices were normal in 5 children and only slightly elevated occasionally in 9 patients
Among them, transiently high serum MTX levels (Patient A) or low urinary pH (Patient B) were accompanied by high NAG indices
MTX toxicity has been diagnosed in 3 cases, when permanently high NAG indices were in accordance with other clinical signs
